Package edu.cnm.deepdive.diceware

Class Generator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.diceware.Generator
  • public class Generator
extends Object
    This class implements a simple passphrase generator, using a provided pool of words (specified as either a String[], a ResourceBundle, or a file Path from which words are read) and a Random instance as a source of randomness. (The latter should be of cryptographic quality.)
    Author:
    Nicholas Bennett & Deep Dive Coding Java Cohort 4

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Generator​(String[] words, Random rng)
      Initializes Generator instance with the specified String[] word list and Random instance.
      Generator​(Path path, Random rng)
      Initializes Generator instance with the contents of the specified Path as a word list and Random instance.
      Generator​(ResourceBundle words, Random rng)
      Initializes Generator instance with the specified ResourceBundle word list (keys are ignored) and Random instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      String next()
      Returns a randomly selected word.
      String[] next​(int numWords)
      Returns a random passphrase as a String[] of words, with no restriction on word duplication.
      String[] next​(int numWords, boolean duplicatesAllowed)
      Returns a random passphrase as a String[] of words.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Generator

        public Generator​(String[] words,
                 Random rng)
          throws NullPointerException,
                 IllegalArgumentException
        Initializes Generator instance with the specified String[] word list and Random instance.
        Parameters:
        words - list of words.
        rng - source of randomness.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if words or rng is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if words is empty.

      • Generator

        public Generator​(ResourceBundle words,
                 Random rng)
          throws NullPointerException,
                 IllegalArgumentException
        Initializes Generator instance with the specified ResourceBundle word list (keys are ignored) and Random instance.
        Parameters:
        words - list of words (keys ignored).
        rng - source of randomness.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if words or rng is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if words is empty.

      • Generator

        public Generator​(Path path,
                 Random rng)
          throws NullPointerException,
                 IllegalArgumentException,
                 IOException
        Initializes Generator instance with the contents of the specified Path as a word list and Random instance. When reading from the word list file, any leading or trailing non-alphanumeric characters on each line are ignored, along with all but the final set of alphanumeric characters on the line.
        Parameters:
        path - file location to read.
        rng - source of randomness.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if words or rng is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if words is empty.
        IOException - if path can't be opened, or its contents can't be read.

    • Method Detail

      • next

        public String next()
        Returns a randomly selected word.
        Returns:
        selected word.

      • next

        public String[] next​(int numWords,
                     boolean duplicatesAllowed)
              throws NegativeArraySizeException,
                     IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a random passphrase as a String[] of words. duplicatesAllowed controls the possible repetition of words in in the passphrase returned.
        Parameters:
        numWords - length of passphrase.
        duplicatesAllowed - flag controlling word repetition.
        Returns:
        selected passphrase.
        Throws:
        NegativeArraySizeException - if numWords < 0.
        IllegalArgumentException - if duplicatesAllowed is false and numWords exceeds the number of words in the word list.

      • next

        public String[] next​(int numWords)
              throws NegativeArraySizeException
        Returns a random passphrase as a String[] of words, with no restriction on word duplication. Invoking this method is equivalent to invoking next(numWords, true).
        Parameters:
        numWords - length of passphrase.
        Returns:
        selected passphrase.
        Throws:
        NegativeArraySizeException - if numWords < 0.
